place.name: EAST BARKWITH
place.gazetteerText: BARKWITH (East), a parish in Horncastle district, Lincoln; 3½ miles NE of Wragby, and 5½ E by S of Wickenby r. station. Post Town, Wragby. Acres, 990. Real property, £1,776. Pop., 387. Houses, 74. The property is divided among a few. The manor belongs to G. F. Heneage, Esq. Living, a rectory in the dio. of Lincoln. Value, £230.* Patrons, Dean and Chap. of Lincoln. The church is good; and there is a Wesleyan chapel. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
